author: mariadalfonso
body:
This PR save some CPU time here and there in the local RECO HBHE.
No changes expected in the offline reco.

1. Reference is plain 10_0_2: 
https://deguio.web.cern.ch/deguio/cgi-bin/igprof-navigator/MAHI/igreport_perf2017_CMSSW_10_0_2/15
2. Improvements at https://deguio.web.cern.ch/deguio/cgi-bin/igprof-navigator/MAHI/igreport_perf2017_CMSSW_10_0_X_2018-02-20-1100_profileTimeMahi+MRbranch+PS207+PR22206/15

customizeHLTforCMSSW contains also the port of the setting in PR21840,21733.
The port of the PR21733 setting expected to change the scale of the regional MAHI.

3. Improvements at: https://deguio.web.cern.ch/deguio/cgi-bin/igprof-navigator/MAHI/igreport_perf2017_CMSSW_10_0_X_2018-02-20-1100_profileTimeMahi+MRbranch+PS207+PR22206_chi2+15/15

As agreed at the TSGfeb21, we uniformise the online/offline local reco and use MAHI everywhere w/o any regional https://its.cern.ch/jira/browse/CMSHLT-1726
The setting in the customizeHLTforCMSSW can be taken care together with the full move to MAHI and regional
@silviodonato @Martin-Grunewald 

Once we are all happy with the review we will backport to the 10_0_X as well (as asked at the PPD to avoid creating confusion in various validation/calibration campains together with https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/21821 )

@deguio
title: HBHE: Local reco cpu and hlt setting
